<<<<<<< HEAD
A dreadful oration deliver'd by that sorely afflicted saint, Stephen Lobb held forth to the brethren since his last retirement, (at a private meeting by night to escape persecution,) in his antient meeting-house, near Swallow-Street, not far from that famous Whigg-Sqvare. Lobb, Stephen, d. 1699.
[2], 18, [1] p. : music.
Printed by N.T. ..., [London] : 1683.
A satire. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

Printed by N.T. ..., [London] : 1683.
